definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Linda:It tooks you the whole night, 8 hours to be exact, to think about that?
sentences.chinese: 這要花掉你整個晚上，就是說八小時，來想這個問題？

sentences.english: The money was spent for his own behoof .
sentences.chinese: 那筆錢是爲他自己花掉的。

sentences.english: It will take a big bite out of my salary to sit in that English class.
sentences.chinese: 要參加那個英語班得花掉我大部分工資呀。

sentences.english: Deficits are financed by borrowing money that would otherwise be unspent.
sentences.chinese: 用以填補赤字的是原本不會被花掉的金錢。

sentences.english: This car cost me over ten thousand dollars.
sentences.chinese: 這輛車花掉了我一萬多美元。

sentences.english: This can eat up half of your day or more.
sentences.chinese: 這些會議能花掉你半天甚至更多的時間。

sentences.english: To my calculation you have spent more than seven hundred thousand francs.
sentences.chinese: 根據我的計算你花掉了多於七十萬法郎。
一張照片總共要花掉好幾天，也有輻射危害。

sentences.english: People complained that their money was flowing out.
sentences.chinese: 老百姓們抱怨說他們的錢如流水般給花掉了。

sentences.english: How can you possibly spend that much?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼有可能花掉那麼多的錢呢？

sentences.english: Often a person will spend an obscene amount of money on a telephone in order to exude an aura of sophistication.
sentences.chinese: 一個人經常會花掉大筆的錢買手機，以此裝酷炫耀。

sentences.english: It is very rare today for a restaurant meal to set the epicure back an entire month's earning.
sentences.chinese: 今天很少說是去餐館美餐一頓就會花掉整個月的工資。

sentences.english: He had some money now and found ways to spend it on his buying trips.
sentences.chinese: 他有了些錢，不過都雜七雜八地花掉了。

sentences.english: He has to account to the chairman   for all the money he spends.
sentences.chinese: 他必須向主席說明他所花掉所有錢的去向。

sentences.english: Money was being spent every day, but how it was spent could not be accounted for.
sentences.chinese: 每天都在花錢，可是又解釋不清這些錢是如何花掉的。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
to skip stones (on water)/(coll.) to squander one's money on a bad investment
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
